reasoning: Benign Rolandic Epilepsy (awakening epilepsy) is the most common childhood epilepsy with incidence ~15 per 100k children per year. Reporting incidence (new diagnoses) rather than prevalence. Estimate based on epidemiological studies from pediatric populations.
source: Eeg-Olofsson O et al. (1982). The natural history of benign rolandic epilepsy of childhood. Epilepsia. 23(1):61-75. Also referenced in Camfield PR & Camfield CS (1994). Epileptic syndromes in childhood. Clin Neurosci. 2(3):165-168
